ygData.subject: Re: The great panic
ygData.msgSnippet: Fury is frozen by fear and knocked away, but Riekan s emotion chips were changed to match his organic side - a great white shark - and he has only two major

Fury is frozen by fear and knocked away, but Riekan's emotion chips 
were changed to match his organic side - a great white shark - and he 
has only two major moods; his normal, brooding self and a blind 
frenzy.  Things like fear and love are beyond him other than in small 
quantities.  His free arm comes up automatically to block the sword - 
which promptly becomes lodged in it.  Between that pain and the 
emotional overload, the shark-bot is driven into the Jaws-like 
behavior people would expect of his beast form.  With a roar, he 
latches onto Dreadplague's throat with an iron grip, fairly well 
wrenching the sword out of the femme's hands and exacerbating his own 
wound.  He headbutts his antagonist, twisting the harpoon lodged in 
her body so that it starts tearing through her internal systems.

Noir narrowly avoids the shards and retaliates with her blasters.  
Jayde proves to be an even harder target to pin down in vehicle mode 
than as a robot, and scoots under Tyreal as he jumps.  Coming back 
around, she squeezes off an ion shot from behind.

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic <wingedwarrior41@h...>" 
<wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> Dreadplague shrieks again of a cry scary enough to freeze even the
> most effective coolant. She intensifies her panic grip on both her
> assailants, which diminishes her influence on Jayde and Noir. 
However,
> Fury and Riekan would barely be able to move. It was fear she
> instilled, and that was the only universal unstoppable weapon.
> 
> She raised her sword and the close range allowed her to strike
> directly at his throat. Just after, she kicked at Fury.
> 
> Tyrael shot two light shards at Noir then jumped at Jayde, trying to
> plant his claws in her.
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "cardhead649 <cardhead649@y...>"
> <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > The Rogues pull up to avoid the brunt of the explosion, but it 
> > disrupts their cloaking devices (and singes a few armor plates) 
> > anyway.
> > 
> > Riekan is the nearest Rogue to Dreadplague, but he sees her 
coming 
> > and parries her sword with his shark-fin blade, letting her land 
on 
> > the muzzle of his harpoon gun.  "I don't have to," he hisses as 
he 
> > looses a dragline harpoon - it's too close for an explosive 
bolt.  
> > The gun packs quite a punch; at this range, it would be more than 
> > enough to send the spear-like projectile through any known armor 
> > plating, including technorganic-2's.
> > 
> > Fury dives in on the femme from behind, retracting his lashknife 
into 
> > a short sword and swiping at Dreadplague's back.
> > 
> > The two female Rogues (both in vehicle mode) go for Tyreal, Noir 
> > launching more of her missiles and Jayde firing ion bursts.
> > 
> > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic <wingedwarrior41@h...>" 
> > <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > Dreadplague was aware of the tactic.
> > > 
> > > Dreadplague: Up now!
> > > 
> > > She and Tyrael jumped high in the air. Turning around, her cloak
> > > flying in the air, She charged two massive plasma balls and 
fired
> > > right where they had been. It was undeniable that the explosion 
> > would
> > > get the Rogues.
> > > 
> > > After that, she took hold of her sword and fell down with it 
facing
> > > downward to impale the first unlucky miserable that would get 
in 
> > the way.
> > > 
> > > Her voice became a raucous and guttural one.
> > > 
> > > Dread: You can not hide from me!
> > > 
> > > Tyrael did not know where to attack, so he decided to shoot
> > > needle-like light pins in a cone-manner and reduce the cone 
until he
> > > caught a Rogue or two.
> > > 
> > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "cardhead649 <cardhead649@y...>"
> > > <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > > > The attack comes from four different directions, as the 
Rogues 
> > cloak 
> > > > and split up before sweeping in to strafe the Tripreds from 
the 
> > > > points of the compass.  An old, but effective tactic - no 
matter 
> > > > where you look, you're turning your back on a Rogue, and that 
can 
> > be 
> > > > a fatal error.
> > > > 
> > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Nic <wingedwarrior41@h...>" 
> > > > <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> > > > > Dreadplague raised an eyebrow.
> > > > > 
> > > > > Dreadplague: Oh? I hadn't realized we had an ally here.
> > > > > 
> > > > > She stopped affecting Kaiser with panic and she saw the 
Rogues 
> > were
> > > > > starting to get up and were likely to be on her. She raised 
her 
> > > > sword
> > > > > defiantly.
> > > > > 
> > > > > Dreadplague: I think we start to fight now, right, father?
> > > > > 
> > > > > Tyrael: This looks like it... Show them what you are made 
of!
> > > > > 
> > > > > They both stood ready for the insoming assault, Dread with 
her 
> > sword
> > > > > and Tyrael with his talon.
> > > > > 
> > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "cardhead649 
<cardhead649@y...>"
> > > > > <cardhead649@y...> wrote:
> > > > > > Devilcat is undeterred, letting off a lightning-quick 
flurry 
> > of 
> > > > > > attacks: he slashes with his sword, then launches a kick 
from 
> > the 
> > > > > > other side, and finally fires a point-blank burst from 
his 
> > chest-
> > > > > > mounted subspace cannon.  All of this takes about two 
seconds.
> > > > > > 
> > > > > > --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Rudra656@a... wrote:
> > > > > > > ::Kaiser::
> > > > > > >        His breathing accelerates wildly before he 
manages 
> > to 
> > > > grab a 
> > > > > > hold of 
> > > > > > > himself.  He transforms into his griffin form and 
deflects 
> > > > > > Devilcat's slash 
> > > > > > > with a metallic talon.  Calming himself he focuses his 
> > energy 
> > > > on 
> > > > > > the battle, 
> > > > > > > forcing himself into the emotionless zone of battle.
